info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:52PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cochise and northeastern Santa Cruz Counties through 530 PM MST... At 452 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sierra Vista, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sierra Vista, Hereford, Whetstone, Huachuca City, Sonoita, Elgin, Fort Huachuca, Parker Canyon Lake, Charleston, Canelo and Ramsey Canyon Preserve. This includes the following highways... Route 82 between mile markers 31 and 38, and between mile markers 46 and 55. Route 83 between mile markers 3 and 35. Route 90 between mile markers 308 and 327. Route 92 between mile markers 322 and 336. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
